title: Kerala Lottery Results 21.12.2024: Karunya KR-685 Winners Announced; Full List Here! - News18
summary:
Kerala Lottery Results: Karunya KR-685 Winners Announced

Date: December 21, 2024, Source: News18

The results of the Kerala Lottery's Karunya KR-685 lucky draw have been announced, revealing significant cash prizes including a top reward of Rs 80 lakh.

  • First prize: KV 829857 (Vadakara) - Rs 80 lakh
  • Second prize: KW 948415 (Thirur) - Rs 5 lakh
  • Third prize: KN 945606 (Thirur) and others - Rs 1 lakh

title: Once endorsed by MS Dhoni, this soap brand was forgotten. Now, Anand Mahindra to start buying | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Anand Mahindra Revives Interest in Mysore Sandal Soap

Date: December 21, 2024
Source: Live Mint

Anand Mahindra, the chairperson of Mahindra Group, expresses nostalgia for Mysore Sandal Soap, planning to purchase it again after sharing a video that highlights its production process.

“Overwhelmed by nostalgia upon seeing this clip. Delighted to see that it survives—and thrives. Going to start buying it again and inhaling the fragrance of tradition!” — Anand Mahindra

Mysore Sandal Soap Expansion Plans

The iconic Mysore Sandal Soap, produced by Karnataka Soaps and Detergents Limited (KSDL), plans to add around 480 new distributors in 2025, aiming to broaden its market across India, especially in northern states.

  • Anand Mahindra reminisces about using Mysore Sandal Soap.
  • The soap is set to undergo product revamp with a new logo and tagline.
  • Major sales come from southern states, with Andhra Pradesh being the highest consumer.
  • KSDL reported its highest turnover in 40 years, reaching ₹1,500 crore.
newTitle: Anand Mahindra Revives Interest in Mysore Sandal Soap

title: Delhi Excise policy case: Delhi Lieutenant Governor gives nod to ED to prosecute Arvind Kejriwal - The Hindu
summary:
Delhi Lieutenant Governor Approves Prosecution of Arvind Kejriwal in Excise Policy Case

Date: December 21, 2024 Source: The Hindu

Ahead of the upcoming 2025 Delhi Assembly Polls, Delhi Lieutenant Governor V.K. Saxena has sanctioned the Enforcement Directorate to prosecute Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) chief and former Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal in the Delhi excise policy case.

  • The ED sought permission for the prosecution on December 5.
  • Senior AAP leader Atishi criticized the timing and intent behind the prosecution, suggesting it misleads the public.
  • The move follows months of investigations into allegations of corruption related to the excise policy.
  • The Delhi High Court has granted the ED additional time to respond to a petition challenging the trial court's decision regarding the case.
“If LG sir has given permission to prosecute Arvind Kejriwal ji, then what is the problem for ED in making the copy of the approval public? This news is being spread only to mislead people and distract them from the issues.” – Atishi

This decision raises significant political tensions as the Delhi Assembly elections approach, highlighting the ongoing controversy surrounding the excise policy.
newTitle: Delhi Lieutenant Governor Approves Prosecution of Arvind Kejriwal in Excise Policy Case

title: PM Narendra Modi arrives in Kuwait, to hold talks on defence, security - Hindustan Times
summary:
PM Narendra Modi Arrives in Kuwait for Talks on Defence and Security

Date: Dec 21, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi has arrived in Kuwait for a two-day official visit to strengthen bilateral ties and discuss various cooperation agreements.

  • PM Modi was invited by Kuwaiti Emir Sheikh Meshal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah.
  • The visit aims to enhance defence and security cooperation between India and Kuwait.
  • Bilateral agreements related to investment and defense are expected to be finalized.
  • The partnership is seen as significant for regional stability and cooperation within the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC).
“I look forward to my meetings with His Highness the Amir... It would be an opportunity to chalk out a roadmap for a futuristic partnership for the benefit of our people and the region,” - PM Modi.

This visit marks a significant diplomatic engagement, reflecting the deep historical ties and mutual interests between India and Kuwait.
newTitle: PM Narendra Modi Arrives in Kuwait for Talks on Defence and Security

title: Kazan Attack: Massive Fire Erupts As 8 Drones Fly Into Buildings In Russian City, Chilling Videos Surface - News18
summary:
Kazan Drone Attack: Buildings Targeted in Chilling Assault

Date: December 21, 2024 Source: News18

Russia experienced a major attack in its city of Kazan as a series of eight drone strikes targeted high-rise buildings. The strikes reportedly occurred in rapid succession, hitting several multi-story buildings.

  • The Russian government accused Ukraine of being behind the drone assault.
  • Emergency response efforts were launched and residents evacuated from the affected buildings.
  • Kazan airport operations were temporarily suspended due to the attack.
  • Russian air defenses managed to down one drone, but others penetrated defenses.
  • This attack follows a recent drone and missile assault by Russia on Ukrainian cities.
"The Russian government accused Ukraine of being behind the drone assault."

The drone attack on Kazan highlights the ongoing tensions and hostilities between Russia and Ukraine, further escalating the conflict.
newTitle: Kazan Drone Attack: Buildings Targeted in Chilling Assault

title: Priyanka Gandhi bristles as BJP MP gifts her 'Sikh genocide' bag - The Times of India
summary:
Priyanka Gandhi bristles as BJP MP gifts her 'Sikh genocide' bag

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

In a tense exchange in Parliament, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra confronted BJP MP Aparajita Sarangi over a politically charged gift referencing the 1984 Sikh massacre.

  • Priyanka Gandhi warned Sarangi not to ambush her during Parliament proceedings.
  • Gandhi was initially courteous upon receiving the tote bag before reacting negatively upon reading its message.
  • The incident highlights ongoing tensions between Congress and BJP members in the Lok Sabha.
“yeh mere saath mat kariyo (don't do this with me)” - Priyanka Gandhi Vadra

This incident underscores the high level of political tension and the symbolic nature of political gifts in India.
newTitle: Priyanka Gandhi Reacts Strongly to BJP MP's Controversial Gift

title: Ambedkar row: Amit Shah bitten by 'rabid dog,' says Karnataka minister Priyank Kharge - Deccan Herald
summary:
Karnataka Minister Priyank Kharge Criticizes Amit Shah's Remarks on Ambedkar

Published: 21 December 2024, 08:50 IST

Karnataka Minister for IT and BT, Priyank Kharge, condemned Union Home Minister Amit Shah's comments regarding B.R. Ambedkar, accusing him of being out of touch with the principles of equality.

  • Kharge stated that Shah has been "bitten by a rabid dog" in his views about Ambedkar.
  • The minister emphasized the importance of Ambedkar's philosophy for achieving political, social, and economic equality.
  • Shah's remarks have stirred controversy, with accusations that the Congress party is anti-Ambedkar and anti-reservation.
"The more Ambedkar and Basava philosophy grow, the RSS ideology will diminish," - Priyank Kharge
newTitle: Karnataka Minister Priyank Kharge Criticizes Amit Shah's Remarks on Ambedkar

title: Elon Musk calls German Christmas market attack 'Deliberate mass murder'; adds 'Wow, this is ...' - The Times of India
Rohit Sharma nets session: No nonsense from fans to lengthy discussions over dismissals - The Times of India
summary:
Rohit Sharma nets session: No nonsense from fans to lengthy discussions over dismissals

Publication Date: Unknown | Source: Times of India

The Indian cricket team trained at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, attracting the attention of fans who gathered to see their favorite players, especially Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli. The session was serious, focusing on Rohit's preparation for the upcoming Boxing Day Test.

  • Rohit was criticized for his recent poor performance, which included several low scores this tour.
  • He practiced with spin bowlers and engaged with younger players, providing guidance and encouragement.
  • An animated discussion with assistant coach Abhishek Nayar focused on Rohit's batting techniques and recent dismissals.
  • Rohit aims to improve his form in the next two Tests, especially in front of a large crowd for the Boxing Day match.
“Shuru main thoda aaram se daalo.” - Rohit Sharma advising on gentle throwdowns.

Rohit Sharma is determined to turn his form around in the upcoming Tests, knowing the significance of performing well in front of passionate fans.
newTitle: Rohit Sharma's Intense Nets Session Ahead of Boxing Day Test

title: 'They are not interested in helping Prithvi Shaw out': Former India cricketer criticises MCA's comments - The Times of India
summary:
Former India Cricketer Critiques MCA's Support for Prithvi Shaw

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

In a recent discussion, a former Indian cricketer expressed disappointment over the Mumbai Cricket Association's lack of support for Prithvi Shaw, highlighting the need for better backing from cricketing bodies.

  • The MCA's comments were viewed as insufficient towards Shaw's current struggles.
  • Criticism focuses on the need for better support for players facing challenges.
  • The former cricketer emphasized the importance of backing from the cricket community.
“They are not interested in helping Prithvi Shaw out,” the cricketer stated.

The situation underlines a growing concern about how players are supported by their respective associations during difficult times.
newTitle: Former India Cricketer Critiques MCA's Support for Prithvi Shaw

title: 7 amazing, unseen photos of galaxy clusters shared by NASA - India.com
summary:
7 Amazing, Unseen Photos of Galaxy Clusters Shared by NASA

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: India.com

This article showcases seven incredible photographs of galaxy clusters, highlighting their beauty and the scientific wonders they represent.

  • Perseus Cluster: Hosts a supermassive black hole that emits eerie sound waves, visible in X-ray and optical light.
  • Coma Cluster: A densely packed cluster with over 1,000 galaxies, offering valuable insights into galactic evolution.
  • Bullet Cluster: Provides strong evidence of dark matter through the collision of two galaxy clusters.
  • Abell 1689: Acts like a cosmic magnifying glass, bending light from distant galaxies.
  • MACS J1149.5+2223: Known for its gravitational lensing effects that reveal a distant supernova.
  • Pandora's Cluster (Abell 2744): A complex cosmic collision with multiple merged galaxy clusters.
  • El Gordo Cluster: The largest and hottest galaxy cluster observed in the distant universe.
“These images reveal the intricate and stunning nature of our universe, showcasing both its beauty and complexity.”

The article celebrates the marvels of the universe through these captivating images, inviting readers to explore the cosmos.
newTitle: Discover Stunning Images of Galaxy Clusters Shared by NASA

title: 'Notorious' stand, beer towers, and Boxing Day madness: MCG braces for Australia vs India - The Times of India
summary:
Notorious stand, beer towers, and Boxing Day madness: MCG braces for Australia vs India

Publication Date: December 26, 2023 | Source: Times of India

On December 26, the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG) is set to host a sold-out crowd of nearly 100,000 for the highly-anticipated Boxing Day Test between Australia and India. Security measures have been ramped up in response to the expected rowdy atmosphere, particularly from a notorious group known for their loud behavior.

  • Over 100,000 spectators expected for the match, with additional security personnel deployed.
  • Security staff count increased from 10 to up to 20 per block to manage the crowd.
  • Tickets for resale are fetching steep premiums, with prices rising from 30 AUD to upwards of 150 AUD.
  • Local marketplaces buzzing with fans reselling tickets, creating a festive and chaotic environment.
"They just come and drink. That loud bunch in those blue blocks. Beer just flows and expect the beer glass towers to get taller as the game progresses." - Security guard at MCG

The excitement leading up to the match showcases the vibrant cricket culture in Australia, with festivities continuing through the New Year.
newTitle: MCG Prepares for Australia vs India: Anticipating Boxing Day Chaos

title: Trouble For Arvind Kejriwal, Delhi Lt Governor Allows Probe Agency To Prosecute Him - NDTV
GST Council Meeting Live Updates: Defers insurance overhaul, recommends 18% tax on used EVs and smaller cars - BusinessLine
Rival protests over South Korea's impeached President Yoon held in Seoul - CNA
summary:
Rival Protests Erupt in Seoul Over Impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol

Publication Date: December 21, 2024 | Source: Channel News Asia

On December 21, 2024, demonstrators supporting and opposing President Yoon Suk Yeol held rival protests in Seoul, following Yoon's impeachment over his declaration of martial law.

  • Protests were held several hundred meters apart in Gwanghwamun.
  • Tens of thousands of anti-Yoon protesters called for his arrest while expressing concerns over democracy.
  • Several thousand pro-Yoon supporters opposed his removal and supported the restoration of his powers.
  • The National Election Commission denied Yoon's claims regarding election hacking and pro-North Korean sympathizers.
"I wanted to ask Yoon how he could do this to a democracy in the 21st century... he should step down." - Cho Sung-hyo, 27

The protests highlight the deep divisions in South Korean society over the political future of Yoon Suk Yeol, as debates continue about the implications of his martial law declaration.
newTitle: Rival Protests Erupt in Seoul Over Impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol

title: OnePlus 13R Chipset Details Confirmed Ahead Of India Launch On January 7; Check Expected Specs, Price - Zee News
summary:
OnePlus 13R Chipset Details Confirmed Ahead Of India Launch On January 7

Date: January 7, 2023 Source: Zee News

The Chinese electronics company OnePlus is set to launch its OnePlus 13R smartphone in India during the OnePlus Winter Launch Event on January 7, along with the OnePlus Buds Pro 3. The company has confirmed that the device will be powered by the Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 chipset.

Expected Price In India

The OnePlus 13R is anticipated to be priced around Rs 45,000, comparable to competitors like the Vivo V30 Pro and Realme GT 6.

Expected Specifications

  • 6.82-inch Quad-HD+ LTPO AMOLED display with a 120Hz refresh rate
  • Peak brightness of 4,500 nits
  • Dolby Vision support
  • 6,000mAh battery with 100W wired and 50W wireless charging
  • Snapdragon 8 Elite SoC with up to 24GB LPDDR5X RAM and 1TB UFS 4.0 storage
  • Triple camera setup: 50MP main, 50MP ultrawide, 50MP telephoto with 3x optical zoom
  • 32MP front camera for selfies

Both the OnePlus 13R and its predecessor are expected to run ColorOS 15 based on Android 15.
newTitle: OnePlus 13R Chipset and Launch Details Announced for India

title: Mumbai boat accident: Body of missing boy found off Mumbai coast; toll rises to 15 - The Hindu
summary:
Mumbai Boat Accident: Recovery of Missing Boy Raises Death Toll to 15

Published: December 21, 2024 01:05 pm IST

Source: The Hindu

The body of a seven-year-old boy missing from the Mumbai ferry accident was recovered, raising the death toll from the tragedy to 15. The Navy has launched an investigation into this incident.

  • The boy was among those missing after a ferry collided with a Navy craft on December 18, 2024.
  • A total of 113 people were on board both vessels; 98 were rescued, including two injured.
  • The ferry was reportedly overloaded and had permission for only 90 people according to maritime documents.
  • The license of the ferry has been cancelled by the Maharashtra Maritime Board due to the overcrowding.
“This is one of the deadliest crashes in the city's harbour area,” said a Navy official.

As investigations continue, actions are being taken against those responsible for the tragic incident.
newTitle: Mumbai Boat Accident: Recovery of Missing Boy Raises Death Toll to 15

Delhi L-G gives nod to ED to prosecute Kejriwal in excise policy scam case, officials claim; AAP calls it ‘harassment’ - The Indian Express
summary:
Delhi L-G Gives Nod to ED to Prosecute Kejriwal in Excise Policy Scam Case

Date: December 2024 | Source: Indian Express

Delhi Lieutenant Governor V K Saxena has approved the Enforcement Directorate (ED) to prosecute Arvind Kejriwal in a case related to an excise policy scam, a move AAP describes as harassment.

  • The ED sought permission to prosecute Kejriwal regarding irregularities in the excise policy for the year 2021-22.
  • Several AAP leaders have been jailed amid the ongoing investigation.
  • AAP claims the prosecution sanction is a political tool used against them.
  • The investigation has led to extensive raids and document filings without any financial recovery.
“The so-called liquor scam investigation has dragged on for two years... not a single penny has been recovered,” AAP alleged.

The decision has further intensified the political conflict between the AAP government and the Lieutenant Governor's office, highlighting ongoing tensions in Delhi's governance.
newTitle: Delhi L-G Approves ED to Prosecute Kejriwal in Excise Policy Case Amid AAP's Claims of Harassment

Delhi Lieutenant Governor V K Saxena has approved the Enforcement Directorate (ED) to prosecute Arvind Kejriwal in a case related to an excise policy scam, a move AAP describes as harassment.

title: 'Build stadium at border': Pakistan batter Shehzad suggests bizarre idea for IND-PAK matches, unhappy with ICC’s plan - Hindustan Times
summary:
Build stadium at border: Pakistan batter Shehzad suggests bizarre idea for IND-PAK matches, unhappy with ICC’s plan

Date: Dec 21, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

Pakistan cricketer Ahmed Shehzad expressed disappointment with the ICC's new hybrid model for India-Pakistan cricket matches, suggesting a controversial idea for a stadium located at the India-Pakistan border.

  • The ICC approved a hybrid model for the upcoming Champions Trophy due to diplomatic tensions.
  • Shehzad believes this decision locks Pakistan out of future chances to host India for ICC events.
  • He proposed building a stadium at the border, with separate entrances for players from both nations.
  • Despite this idea, Shehzad noted practical issues like visa regulations preventing Indian players from crossing over.
  • Pakistan is the defending Champions Trophy winner, having last faced India in the 2024 T20 World Cup.
“Pakistan had a golden chance to host India. ICC cannot back off. PCB has missed the chance I think.” – Ahmed Shehzad

Shehzad's suggestion highlights the ongoing challenges facing cricketing relations between India and Pakistan, reflecting a deep desire for competitive matches amidst political realities.
newTitle: Shehzad Proposes Unique Stadium Idea for India-Pakistan Matches Amid ICC Hybrid Model Plans

Mamata Machinery IPO: GMP jumps after strong subscription status. Should you apply as the issue ends on Monday? | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Mamata Machinery IPO: GMP jumps after strong subscription status

Date: December 23, 2024
Source: Live Mint

Bidding for the Mamata Machinery IPO ends today, with strong subscription numbers and positive grey market sentiments.

Key Points:

  • The IPO opened on December 19, 2024, and closes at 5:00 PM on December 23, 2024.
  • The IPO was subscribed 37.75 times, with the retail portion oversubscribed 51.03 times.
  • The grey market premium (GMP) stood at ₹261, signaling strong market interest.
  • Experts recommend subscribing to the IPO, citing Mamata Machinery's growth potential and unique market position.
"Mamata Machinery is strategically focused on strengthening relationships with existing customers and expanding its product offerings across geographies to drive growth." - Prathamesh Masdekar, Research Analyst

Investors are advised to make swift decisions as the IPO closes today, with expected allotment on December 24 and listing on December 27.
newTitle: Mamata Machinery IPO: GMP Surges Amid Strong Subscription; Last Chance to Apply

title: NASA tracks 120-foot asteroid 2024 XN1 nearing Earth on Christmas eve - The Times of India
summary:
NASA Tracks 120-Foot Asteroid 2024 XN1 Approaching Earth this Christmas Eve

Publication Date: Not specified   Source: Not specified

An asteroid named 2024 XN1 is set to safely pass Earth at a distance of approximately 4,480,000 miles on Christmas Eve.

  • The asteroid measures roughly the size of a 10-story building.
  • It is traveling at a speed of 14,743 miles per hour.
  • NASA confirms that 2024 XN1 and other asteroids passing by this week pose no threat to Earth.
  • Near-Earth objects are monitored closely by NASA's Center for Near-Earth Object Studies.
  • Recent initiatives focus on tracking potentially hazardous asteroids (PHAs) that could threaten Earth.
"NASA uses cutting-edge radar systems to keep a close watch on Near-Earth Objects (NEOs), prioritizing the detection of potential threats."

This event highlights NASA's ongoing efforts to monitor near-Earth asteroids and ensure planetary safety.
newTitle: NASA Tracks 120-Foot Asteroid 2024 XN1 Approaching Earth this Christmas Eve

title: Heart muscles can regenerate in some people, says study - The Hans India
Arrest warrant against cricketer Robin Uthappa for not paying PF to his employees - The Hindu
summary:
Arrest Warrant Issued for Cricketer Robin Uthappa Over PF Cheating Case

Published: December 21, 2024 11:48 am IST | Source: The Hindu

An arrest warrant has been issued against former India cricketer Robin Uthappa in an alleged Provident Fund (PF) cheating case. The warrant was issued by PF Regional Commissioner Shadakshari Gopal Reddy, who has asked the jurisdictional Pulakeshinagar police to take necessary action.

  • The warrant was executed on December 4 but Uthappa was not found at his residence.
  • Uthappa is accused of deducting PF contributions from employee salaries but failing to deposit those funds into their accounts.
  • He currently resides in Dubai with his family.
“The warrant which was executed on December 4 has been returned after Mr. Uthappa was found not to be at the Pulakeshinagar residence,” officials said.

This incident highlights the serious implications of financial misconduct involving employee welfare funds.
newTitle: Arrest Warrant Issued for Cricketer Robin Uthappa Over PF Cheating Case

title: 40 kg silver, bundles of notes recovered from former Transport Department constable's house in Bhopal - Deccan Herald
summary:
40 kg silver, bundles of notes recovered from former Transport Department constable's house in Bhopal

Published: 21 December 2024, 06:06 IST | Source: ANI

During a Lokayukta raid on Friday in Bhopal, significant assets were recovered from the house of a former constable of the Transport Department.

  • 40 kg of silver was found.
  • Bundles of currency notes were also recovered.
  • Just a day prior, assets worth over Rs 3 crore, including Rs 2.85 crore in cash, were seized from another former constable in the same department.
  • In addition to cash, gold valued at Rs 50 lakh and further silver were confiscated.
  • Documents pertaining to properties were found and are under review.
This comes just a day after the Lokayukta Police on Thursday recovered assets of more than Rs 3 crore...

The recent raids shed light on corruption within the Transport Department, highlighting the extent of illicit gains amongst former officials.
newTitle: 40 kg silver, bundles of notes recovered from former Transport Department constable's house in Bhopal

title: US government shutdown averted as funding bill clears Senate - Hindustan Times
summary:
US Government Shutdown Averted as Funding Bill Clears Senate

Date: Dec 21, 2024 11:48 AM IST | Source: Hindustan Times

The United States government managed to avoid a shutdown as the Senate worked through the night to ensure the passage of a bipartisan funding bill to manage federal operations temporarily.

  • The House of Representatives approved the bill by a margin of 366-34 before it went to the Senate.
  • The Senate voted 85-11 in favor of the bill, averting a shutdown.
  • The funding package will last until March 14 and includes $100 billion in disaster aid and $10 billion in agricultural assistance.
  • Outgoing President Joe Biden is expected to sign the legislation into law.
“This is a good time for the country,” said Speaker Mike Johnson after the House vote.

This legislative action has made sure that the essential services of the government continue without interruption.
newTitle: US Government Shutdown Averted as Funding Bill Clears Senate
